user_sentiment: Neutral to slightly directive. The follow-up 'commit the protocol change too' suggests the user had additional uncommitted work they wanted included.
execution_quality: The agent executed git commands appropriately but the immediate follow-up suggests the initial commit may not have included all desired changes, indicating incomplete scope awareness on the first attempt.
work_category: Git commit workflow task. User requested committing changes, then immediately asked to include an additional protocol change in the commit.
summary: The agent performed git operations but incompletely understood the scope of changes the user wanted committed. The immediate follow-up request for 'the protocol change too' reveals the first commit didn't capture all intended modifications. While the agent executed technical steps correctly, it failed to align with the user's actual intent of committing all pending work in a comprehensive manner.
follow_up_pattern: User discovered the initial commit was incomplete and needed to explicitly request the protocol change be added. This indicates the agent may not have staged or understood the full scope of pending changes before committing.
